Description: Lip sherd of North Ionian Middle II to Late Wild Goat Style pottery oinochoe;light ridge at top of neck; interior, top of lip glazed; exterior, white slip: glazed (fired brown) with reserved band near bottom; part of eye decoration in added white.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

For parallels, see British Museum 1907,1201.691; Cambridge Museum of Classical Archaeology NA38, Copenhagen 5607 in Cook and Dupont, 1998, p. 55, fig. 8.20. See also Rhodes 11544 in CVA, Rodi, Museo Archeologico Dello Spedale Dei Cavalieri 2, II.D.H.1, Pl.(475) 7.1
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.621)
